00022 #ifndef VMI_OSLIB_H
00023 #define VMI_OSLIB_H
00024 
00025 // Common area includes
00026 #include "hostapi/impTypes.h"
00027 
00028 // VMI area includes
00029 #include "vmi/vmiCommand.h"
00030 #include "vmi/vmiRt.h"
00031 #include "vmi/vmiTypes.h"
00032 #include "vmi/vmiTyperefs.h"
00033 
00034 
00035 // The "whence" parameter to vmiosLSeek() should be one of these
00036 // enumeration constants.
00037 typedef enum {
00038     VMIOS_SEEK_SET = 0,
00039     VMIOS_SEEK_CUR = 1,
00040     VMIOS_SEEK_END = 2
00041 } vmiosSeekWhenceE;
00042 
00043 // The "flags" parameter to vmiosOpen() should be a bitwise-or of one of these:
00044 #define VMIOS_O_RDONLY  0x0000
00045 #define VMIOS_O_WRONLY  0x0001
00046 #define VMIOS_O_RDWR    0x0002
00047 // with any number of these:
00048 #define VMIOS_O_CREAT   0x0200
00049 #define VMIOS_O_TRUNC   0x0400
00050 #define VMIOS_O_APPEND  0x0008
00051 
00052 // The mode field within the vmiosStatBuf structure
00053 // holds owner/group/other read/write/execute permissions in the
00054 // low 9 bits, plus the following flags
00055 #define VMIOS_S_IFREG   0x1000
00056 #define VMIOS_S_IFDIR   0x4000
00057 
00058 typedef struct vmiosStatBufS {
00059     Uns32 mode;                 // protection
00060     Uns64 size;                 // total size, in bytes
00061     Uns32 blksize;              // blocksize for filesystem I/O
00062     Uns32 blocks;               // number of blocks allocated
00063     Uns32 atime;                // time of last access
00064     Uns32 mtime;                // time of last modification
00065     Uns32 ctime;                // time of last status change
00066 } vmiosStatBuf;
00067 
00068 typedef struct vmiosTimeBufS {
00069     Uns32 sec;                  // seconds
00070     Uns32 usec;                 // microseconds
00071 } vmiosTimeBuf;
00072 
00073 //
00074 // Get file descriptor to use for stdin
00075 //
00076 Int32 vmiosGetStdin(vmiProcessorP processor);
00077 
00078 //
00079 // Get file descriptor to use for stdin
00080 //
00081 Int32 vmiosGetStdout(vmiProcessorP processor);
00082 
00083 //
00084 // Get file descriptor to use for stdin
00085 //
00086 Int32 vmiosGetStderr(vmiProcessorP processor);
00087 
00088 // RETURN VALUES: all calls return >=0 for success and -errno for failure
00089 
00090 //
00091 // Equivalent to the standard open() library function.
00092 //
00093 Int32 vmiosOpen(
00094     vmiProcessorP processor,
00095     const char   *path,
00096     Int32         flags,
00097     Int32         mode
00098 );
00099 
00100 //
00101 // Equivalent to the standard close() library function.
00102 //
00103 Int32 vmiosClose(
00104     vmiProcessorP processor,
00105     Int32         fd
00106 );
00107 
00108 //
00109 // Equivalent to the standard read() library function.
00110 //
00111 Int32 vmiosRead(
00112     vmiProcessorP processor,
00113     Int32         fd,
00114     memDomainP    domain,
00115     Addr          buf,
00116     Uns32         count
00117 );
00118 
00119 //
00120 // Equivalent to the standard write() library function.
00121 //
00122 Int32 vmiosWrite(
00123     vmiProcessorP processor,
00124     Int32         fd,
00125     memDomainP    domain,
00126     Addr          buf,
00127     Uns32         count
00128 );
00129 
00130 //
00131 // Equivalent to the standard unlink() library function.
00132 //
00133 Int32 vmiosUnlink(
00134     vmiProcessorP processor,
00135     const char   *path
00136 );
00137 
00138 //
00139 // Equivalent to the standard stat() library function.
00140 //
00141 Int32 vmiosStat(
00142     vmiProcessorP processor,
00143     const char   *path,
00144     vmiosStatBufP buf
00145 );
00146 
00147 //
00148 // Equivalent to the standard lstat() library function.
00149 //
00150 Int32 vmiosLStat(
00151     vmiProcessorP processor,
00152     const char   *path,
00153     vmiosStatBufP buf
00154 );
00155 
00156 //
00157 // Equivalent to the standard fstat() library function.
00158 //
00159 Int32 vmiosFStat(
00160     vmiProcessorP processor,
00161     Int32         fd,
00162     vmiosStatBufP buf
00163 );
00164 
00165 //
00166 // Equivalent to the standard lseek() library function.
00167 //
00168 Int64 vmiosLSeek(
00169     vmiProcessorP processor,
00170     Int32         fd,
00171     Int64         offset,
00172     Int32         whence
00173 );
00174 
00175 //
00176 // Equivalent to the standard gettimeofday() library function.
00177 //
00178 Int32 vmiosGetTimeOfDay(vmiProcessorP processor, vmiosTimeBufP timebuf);
00179 
00180 //
00181 // Add a command for the passed vmiosObject
00182 //
00183 vmiCommandP vmiosAddCommand(
00184     vmiosObjectP    object,
00185     const char     *name,
00186     const char     *exampleArguments,
00187     vmiosCommandFn  commandCB,
00188     vmiCommandAttrs attrs
00189 );
00190 
00191 //
00192 // Add a command with command parser for the passed processor
00193 // Do not use this function.
00194 //
00195 vmiCommandP vmiosAddCommandParse(
00196     vmiosObjectP        object,
00197     const char         *name,
00198     const char         *exampleArguments,
00199     vmiosCommandParseFn commandCB,
00200     vmiCommandAttrs     attrs
00201 );
00202 
00203 //
00204 // Install an opaque intercept notifier for the intercept library - this is
00205 // called whenever any opaque function intercept is performed, even if the
00206 // intercept is handled by a different intercept library
00207 //
00208 void vmiosInstallInterceptNotifier(
00209     vmiosObjectP             object,
00210     vmiosInterceptNotifierFn notifierCB,
00211     void                    *userData
00212 );
00213 
00214 //
00215 // Return the extension name
00216 //
00217 const char *vmiosGetExtensionName(vmiosObjectP object);
